name: Mbeju
description: This gluten free cheese bread is more like a tortilla. It is crunchy on the outside and gooey on the inside.
ingredients: 4 TBSP cold butter, cut into cubes
4 oz freshly grated mild Cheddar cheese
steps: Combine all ingredients except milk into a bowl. Stir to combine.
Slowly add milk as you mix all ingredients together in your hand. The result should be a clumpy dough.
Cook in a dry skillet for 2 to 3 minutes or until toasted on both sides.

name: Asado a la Olla
description: Similar to pot-roast, this Paraguayan delicacy uses rib meat and is usually served with cheesy rice.
steps: Put the ribs into a pot and start pan frying them.
Once they have gotten brown add bell pepper, salt, black pepper, and cumin and stir.
After a few minutes add a little bit of water and cover.
Cook slowly for at least 30 minutes and until the meat is tender.

name: Milanesa a la Napolitana
description: The breaded steak is covered with tomato sauce, ham, and cheese.
steps: Marinate the beef filets in garlic and salt
Put the beef in the flour
Put the beef in egg wash
Put the beef in seasoned bread crumbs
Fry in a small amount of oil in a frying pan
Once brown, remove and put on a baking sheet
Add tomato sauce, ham, and cheese
Back for 10 minutes at 400 degrees or until cheese is melted

name: Soyo con Tortillas
description: Beef and potato stew that is usually accompanies by Paraguayan tortillas.
steps: Dice the onions and bell peppers and put into a pot
Once the onions are translucent, add the potatoes, garlic and spices and cook for just a minute
Add water and bring to a boil
Add the raw ground beef and stir constantly until all the beef is cooked
Cook tortillas to accompany the stew

name: Chipa
description: Traditional Paraguay cheese bread that is also gluten free. It is usually sold on the street.
steps: Add all the ingredients together and form into a dough
Form the dough into round circles
Bake in the oven at 500 degrees until brown on the outside and gooey in the middle
